uiDefinition.description: The Service Principal for ProofpointTAP API

get.description: Fetch detailed information for a given campaign.

200.description: At least one record matching the specified criteria was found and returned in the response body. In the case of JSON format, the structure is always returned, even if empty.

description.description: a description of the campaign written by one of Proofpoint's threat analysts

startDate.description: an  ISO8601-formatted datetime corresponding to the time the campaign's first threat variants were first observed

notable.description: returns true when the campaign is marked as notable by Proofpoint's Threat Analyst team

actors.description: optional, an array of Actor objects

malware.description: optional, an array of Malware objects

techniques.description: optional, an array of Technique objects

brands.description: optional, an array of Brand objects

threat.description: the attachment hash or URL fragment of the threat

type.description: the type of the threat: attachment or url

threatTime.description: an  ISO8601-formatted datetime corresponding to the the threat variant was first recognized as malicious

400.description: The request is missing a mandatory request parameter, a parameter contains data which is incorrectly formatted, or the API doesn't have enough information to determine the identity of the customer.

401.description: There is no authorization information included in the request, the authorization information is incorrect, or the user is not authorized

404.description: The campaign ID does not exist.

500.description: The service has encountered an unexpected situation and is unable to give a better response to the request.

get.description: Fetch the identities and attack index breakdown of Very Attacked People within your organization for a given period.

parameters.name: window
parameters.description: An integer indicating how many days the data should be retrieved for. Accepted values are 14, 30 and 90.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The maximum number of VAPs to produce in the response. The attackIndex value determine the order of results. Defaults to 1000.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of results to return, in multiples of the specified size (or 1000, if no size is explicitly chosen). Defaults to 1.

200.description: The request was successful. The body of the response contains the requested information in JSON format.

guid.description: a unique identifier within Proofpoint's system

customerUserId.description: a identifier associated with the user which was provided by the customer, usually from their directory

emails.description: a list of email addresses associated with the user

name.description: the name of the user, if known, or null

department.description: the department of the user, if known, or null

location.description: the location of the user, if known, or null

title.description: the name of the user, if known, or null

vip.description: whether the user has been identified as a VIP

attackIndex.description: the attack index value for this user during the selected interval

totalVapUsers.description: an integer describing the total number of VAP users for the interval

interval.description: an ISO8601-formatted interval showing what time the response was calculated for

averageAttackIndex.description: the average attack index value for users during the interval

vapAttackIndexThreshold.description: this interval's attack index threshold, past which a user is considered a VAP

400.description: The request is missing a mandatory request parameter or a parameter contains data which is incorrectly formatted.

401.description: There is no authorization information included in the request, the authorization information is incorrect, or the user is not authorized

500.description: The service has encountered an unexpected situation and is unable to give a better response to the request

generated.description: ISO8601-formatted datetime corresponding to the time this report was generated

scope.description: whether the report scope covers a campaign or an individual threat

id.description: the identifier associated with the campaign or individual threat

type.description: the threat type: attachment, url, or hybrid

name.description: the malicious URL, SHA256 hash of the malicious attachment, or campaign name

malicious.description: whether the evidence was used to reach a malicious verdict

time.description: [Unsupported] This field is currently unsupported and it's expected to always return 0.

what.description: a map of values associated with the specific evidence type

get.description: Fetch forensic information for a given threat or campaign.

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: An string containing a campaign identifier.  CampaignId or threatId parameter must be supplied with each request. They are mutually exclusive.

parameters.name: threatId
parameters.description: An string containing a threat identifier. CampaignId or threatId parameter must be supplied with each request. They are mutually exclusive.

parameters.name: includeCampaignForensics
parameters.description: A boolean value, defaulting to false. May optionally be used with the threatId parameter. It cannot be used with the campaignId parameter.  If false, aggregate forensics for that specific threat identifier will be returned.  If true AND if the threat has been associated with a campaign, aggregate forensics for the entire campaign are returned. Otherwise, aggregate forensics for the individual threat are returned.

guid.description: a unique identifier within Proofpoint's system

customerUserId.description: [Unsupported] a identifier associated with the user which was provided by the customer, usually from their directory

emails.description: a list of email addresses associated with the user

name.description: the name of the user, if known, or null

department.description: the department of the user, if known, or null

location.description: the location of the user, if known, or null

title.description: the name of the user, if known, or null

vip.description: whether the user has been identified as a VIP

clickCount.description: total number of clicks from this user in the time internval

families.description: an array of Threat family objects

clicks.description: total number of clicks on threats belong to this threat family

totalTopClickers.description: an integer describing the total number of top clickers in the time interval

interval.description: an  ISO8601-formatted interval showing what time the response was calculated for

get.description: Fetch the identities and attack index of the top clickers within your organization for a given period. Top clickers are the users who have demonstrated a tendency to click on malicious URLs, regardless of whether the clicks were blocked or not. Knowing who are more susceptible to threats is useful for proactive security approaches such as security training assignments.

parameters.name: window
parameters.description: An integer indicating how many days the data should be retrieved for. Accepted values are 14, 30 and 90.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of results to return, in multiples of the specified size (or 100, if no size is explicitly chosen). Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The maximum number of top clickers to produce in the response. The attackIndex value determine the order of results. Defaults to 100 and the max supported value is 200.

encodedUrl.description: A string, the original, rewritten URL supplied to the endpoint.

decodedUrl.description: A string, the target URL embedded inside the rewritten link.

messageGuid.description: A string, the PPS GUID of the message which originally contained the URL.

clusterName.description: A string, the name of the PPS cluster which rewrote the message.

recipientEmail.description: A string, the email address of the messages' original recipient.

success.description: A boolean, indicates whether the URL could successfully be decoded

post.description: Decodes one or more URLs. Available fields in results vary, depending on if the request is authenticated.
